programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 18 Wolfpack (9-3) match up with the No. 25 Wildcats (8-4) in the Pop-Tarts Bowl. NC State has won this bowl three times, most recently in 2010. Kansas State senior quarterback Will Howard has accounted for 34 touchdowns this season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 12 Sooners line up against the No. 14 Wildcats in the Alamo Bowl. Oklahoma, Alamo champions in 2021, qualified for a 25th consecutive postseason with a 10-2 regular season. Arizona won six straight contests to end a six-year playoff drought.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 12 Sooners line up against the No. 14 Wildcats in the Alamo Bowl. Oklahoma, Alamo champions in 2021, qualified for a 25th consecutive postseason with a 10-2 regular season. Arizona won six straight contests to end a six-year playoff drought.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 18 Wolfpack (9-3) match up with the No. 25 Wildcats (8-4) in the Pop-Tarts Bowl. NC State has won this bowl three times, most recently in 2010. Kansas State senior quarterback Will Howard has accounted for 34 touchdowns this season.

programme.title: SportsCenter

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 22 Tigers appear in a 19th straight postseason as they play the Wildcats in the Gator Bowl. Clemson prevailed in its last four games after a 4-4 start. The Tigers won eight of their last 11 bowls, and two national titles during that span.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A Liberty Bowl rematch sees the Tigers (9-3) play the Cyclones (7-5) on Memphis' home field. Iowa State marched into Simmons Bank Liberty Stadium in 2017, defeating Memphis 21-20. Running back Blake Watson (MEM) totaled 17 TDs in the regular season.

programme.title: College Football Pregame
programme.desc: Preview of the upcoming college football matchup.

programme.title: Goodyear Cotton Bowl Classic
programme.desc: The No. 7 Buckeyes (11-1) tangle with the No. 9 Tigers (10-2) in the Cotton Bowl. Ohio State dropped out of CFP contention with a 30-24 loss at Michigan. Missouri is enjoying its best season since 2014, when it won 11 games and the Citrus Bowl.

programme.title: Ram Trucks Postgame
programme.desc: Football postgame analysis and highlights.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Goodyear Cotton Bowl Classic
programme.desc: The No. 7 Buckeyes (11-1) tangle with the No. 9 Tigers (10-2) in the Cotton Bowl. Ohio State dropped out of CFP contention with a 30-24 loss at Michigan. Missouri is enjoying its best season since 2014, when it won 11 games and the Citrus Bowl.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Hurricanes (7-5) come up against the Scarlet Knights (6-6) in the Pinstripe Bowl from Yankee Stadium. This is the first meeting between the schools since both were members of the Big East in 2003. Miami is 11-0 against Rutgers all-time.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: Chick-fil-A Peach Bowl
programme.desc: The No. 11 Rebels (10-2) compete with the No. 10 Nittany Lions (10-2) in the Peach Bowl. Ole Miss has appeared in a bowl game in each of Lane Kiffin's four years at the helm. Penn State's Drew Allar threw 23 TD passes during his sophomore campaign.

programme.title: Ram Trucks Postgame
programme.desc: Football postgame analysis and highlights.

programme.title: College Football Pregame
programme.desc: Preview of the upcoming college football matchup.

programme.title: Capital One Orange Bowl
programme.desc: The No. 5 Seminoles play the No. 6 Bulldogs in the Orange Bowl. Florida State became the first unbeaten team to be denied a CFP berth despite winning a Power Five conference title. Georgia's 29-game win streak was snapped by Alabama in the SEC final.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Lions celebrate their NFC North title with a Saturday night showdown against the Cowboys. It's Detroit's first crown since 1993, when it took the NFC Central. Dallas is a perfect 7-0 at home. Detroit aims to end a five-game slide against Dallas.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: A recap of the Monday Night Football matchup with highlights, interviews and more.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Inside the College Football Playoff
programme.desc: An all-access series gives viewers a glimpse into each of the top four teams' preparation leading up to and through the semifinals and national championship.

programme.title: Eli's Places
programme.desc: Two-time Super Bowl champion Eli Manning takes on his own version of his brother's signature show to explore what makes college football a way of life across the country.

programme.title: P.K.'s Places
programme.desc: P.K. Subban explores the history of professional hockey. Through conversations with hockey legends of the past and present and celebrities who love the game, P.K. showcases what makes hockey popular from backyards to major stadiums.

programme.title: Bettor Days
programme.desc: A unique point of view on sports history -- reliving it through the lens of a sports bet as various bettors share upbeat, fun and comedic tales of bets with high stakes and unbelievable consequences.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: The 31st season of The Ultimate Fighter begins with the UFC's biggest star, Conor McGregor, returning to coach. McGregor will be coaching against rising powerhouse Michael Chandler. Both coaches pick their teams, setting the stage for a new season.

programme.title: Why Not Us: Howard Golf
programme.desc: Follows both men's and women's golf teams at Howard University as the student-athletes and their coaches navigate the challenges and triumphs of an emerging Division I program.

programme.title: Why Not Us: Howard Golf
programme.desc: Follows both men's and women's golf teams at Howard University as the student-athletes and their coaches navigate the challenges and triumphs of an emerging Division I program.

programme.title: SportsCenter Featured
programme.desc: Unique and compelling feature stories from the world of sports.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Compelling stories centered around sports and athletes, ranging from dramatic to comedic.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: Singles.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: Doubles.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Pac-12 play gets underway with a tilt between the Trojans and Ducks. N'Faly Dante scored 17 points when Oregon beat USC 78-60 in February. Dante and fellow big men Nate Bittle and lauded recruit Mookie Cook have battled injuries in the first half.

programme.title: UFC Greatest Fights
programme.desc: A look at the middleweight main event bout between Anderson Silva and Michael Bisping at UFC Fight Night in London.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Aggies (7-5) and No. 20 Cowboys (9-4) meet in the Texas Bowl for the second time in five years. Texas A&M topped Oklahoma State 24-21 in the 2019 game. The Cowboys come off a 49-21 loss to the CFP-bound Longhorns in the Big 12 championship game.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Eagles stay close to home as they play the No. 24 Mustangs in the Fenway Bowl. Boston College's campus is about four miles from Fenway Park. SMU, the American Athletic Conference champion, has won nine straight. BC has dropped three in a row.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 13 Bulldogs (9-3) aim to carry a perfect home mark into conference play when they face the Aztecs (10-2). Gonzaga is 6-0 at the McCarthey Athletic Center in 2023-24. San Diego State is 1-2 in true road games, including a loss to Grand Canyon.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Sun Devils (6-5, 0-0 Pac-12) aim to get back on track when they face the Cardinal (5-5, 0-0). Arizona State stumbled into conference play with three straight losses. Stanford dropped both contests last season against Arizona State by four points.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: Twice As Nice - The Legend of Charlie Ward
programme.desc: A profile of Charlie Ward, an All-American college football player, quarterback, college basketball player, professional basketball player, and Heisman Trophy winner.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates (7-3) try to use their home-court advantage to end the impeccable form of the No. 1 Gamecocks (11-0). East Carolina has won five in a row, but 0-1 when playing Power Five schools. Danae McNeal leads ECU with 19.5 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Demon Deacons (8-3, 0-0) and Hokies (9-3, 1-0) streak into their ACC affair. Wake Forest has won six straight. Virginia Tech has claimed four in a row. The Deacons held off the Hokies 77-75 last season for their second straight series victory.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Sunflower State sides in the Shockers (8-4) and No. 2 Jayhawks (11-1) face off at Phog Allen Fieldhouse. The programs have met once since 1993, in the 2015 NCAA Tournament when No. 7 seed Wichita State upset No. 2 Kansas 78-65 in the Round of 32.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers and Terrapins tangle in the Music City Bowl. Maryland secured a third straight bowl game appearance by winning two of its final three games, on the road. Quarterback Taulia Tagovailoa accounted for 30 of the Terps' 45 total TDs this year.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: Teqball
programme.desc: Teqball is a ball sport that is played on a curved table, combining elements of football and table tennis.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Filmmaker Billy Corben documents the rise to prominence of the college football program at the University of Miami.

programme.title: One for the Ages

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wolverines and Buckeyes square off as 11-0 teams for the second straight season. A Big Ten championship game berth and an all-but-certain spot in the College Football Playoff await the winner. Michigan won the last two meetings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Red Storm take their act to UBS Arena for a game with the Pride. St. John's fell to 8-4 after a setback at No. 5 UConn on Dec. 23. Storm senior Joel Soriano has double-doubled in five consecutive contests, and is averaging 17.7 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Shades of history are on display as the Spartans (7-5) host the Sycamores (11-1). This is the first meeting since the 1979 NCAA Tournament national championship game, when Magic Johnson's Michigan State bested Larry Bird's Indiana State 75-64.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: An all-Windy City showdown sees the Blue Demons (2-9) host the Cougars (7-10) at Wintrust Arena. Chicago State's four-game win streak, which started via a massive upset of Northwestern, ended Dec. 22 as then-No. 24 Wisconsin claimed an 80-53 victory.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 17 Buckeyes (10-2, 1-0 Big Ten) face the Wolverines (10-3, 1-0). Ohio State swept all three 2022-23 meetings with Michigan, including a Big Ten tournament quarterfinal win. Buckeyes forward Cotie McMahon averaged 15.7 points in those games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Buckeyes (10-2) brace for RaeQuan Battle and the Mountaineers (5-7) in the Legends of Basketball Showcase from Cleveland. Battle, a transfer from Montana State, has totaled 58 points and five steals in two games since becoming eligible to play.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pistons try to break up the Celtics' perfect home mark. Boston is 14-0 at TD Garden in 2023-24, the second-longest streak at home to begin a season in franchise history. The C's have put together 21 consecutive regular-season victories in Boston.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors and Heat, fresh off separate Christmas Day commitments, hit the floor in San Francisco. Golden State plays seven in a row at the Chase Center, where it has taken eight consecutive outings. Miami last won at Golden State in 2020.
